DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether prednisone , methotrexate , cyclophosphamide effective treatment rapidly progressive hearing loss ear due autoimmune inner ear disease ( AIED ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Sudden out-of-hospital cardiac arrest ( OOH-CA ) remain significant cause death , spite recent decline overall mortality cardiovascular disease . Existing method emergency resuscitation inadequate due time delay inherent transport train responder defibrillation capability side OOH-CA victim . Existing Emergency Medical Services ( EMS ) system typically combine paramedic Emergency Medical Technician ( EMT ) service level community involvement , bystander cardiopulmonary resuscitation ( CPR ) training . Some community include automated external defibrillator ( AEDs ) isolate site mobile police fire vehicle . A comprehensive , integrate community approach treatment AEDs would community unit serve volunteer non-medical responder quickly identify treat patient OOH-CA . Such approach term Public Access Defibrillation ( PAD ) .
DOC.criteria: patient pancreatic carcinoma surgery ( resection exploration ) give consent acute infection pain mobility ability walk stand severe neurological disorder ( apoplex , morbus Parkinson , paresis low extremeties ) severe cardiac cardiovascular disease ( z.B . heart insufficiency NYHA III , myocardial infarction < 3 month ) rhytmical disorder , contraindicate ergospirometric examination cardiac therapy digitalis pharmacy unclear syncope severe pulmonal insufficiency renal insufficiency ( GFR < 30 % Krea > 3 mg/dl ) synchronous participation clinical trial
